newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Lower Danish April wholesale prices seen.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Lower Danish April wholesale prices seen.

text.p: Six analysts polled by Reuters in a survey on Friday forecast that Danish wholesale prices in April would rise by an average 1.1 percent on a year-on-year basis, compared to a 1.2 percent increase in March.

On a monthly basis the average rise was foreseen to be 0.3 percent from March to April, up from a 0.1 percent increase from February to March. The estimates were in the +1.0-+1.3 percent and +0.2-+0.5 percent range.
"The annual rise in wholesale prices is being held down by continuing low fuel prices," bank economist Jesper Nielsen at Unidanmark told Reuters.
The Danish national statistics office issues the wholesale data for April on Monday May 26 at 0730 gmt. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
